TopicTitle: Game Freeze when trying to launch a spaceplane from the Hangar.

Articles.Content:
Hello, I have KSP Version 1.0.2. I've reinstalled game recently on steam (a few days ago) and started a new game (career). This is the first time I've tried to make a spaceplane on this save, and basically what happens is I make the plane, check that it doesn't have too many parts or weigh too much, save it and then click on "Launch". And that's when the game freezes (or my like half-freezes). The Launch, Save, New and Close buttons go grey and I can't click them (Esc doesn't do anything either) and I'm stuck in the hangar. 

The music keeps playing, it seems as though the game is running normally (I don't get "not responding" messages), and certain buttons seem to work as normal and get highlighted when I mouse over them. For example, I can mouse over parts and navigate the parts sections, but I can't click on them and put them on the spaceplane, I can read my contracts, change my mission flag and type into the name box. However I can't pan my view or zoom in and out anymore, I'm just stuck and can't get out, and when I reload the save I find that it hasn't even saved my spaceplane.

I tried closing and opening the game, clearing the runway etc... the first time this happened my spaceplane had too many parts so I thought that might be the problem, but I've upgraded my hangar the next time I opened the game, and the same thing happened. It doesn't happen on the rocket assembly area, just the spaceplane hangar. It there a way to upload a picture from my computer or do I need to put it on the internet and type the URL in?
Hi Konan, can you post the pics to [imgur](imgur.com) please, and your logs to a text paste site.

Hi, here's an imgur link to a screenshot of the hangar after the freeze. I can still move my mouse, still navigate the parts menus and most buttons get highlighted normally when I mouse over them. However, as you can see, the Launch, Close, Save and New buttons are greyed out and they don't work.

![ABXGO48.jpg?1](http://i.imgur.com/ABXGO48.jpg?1)

Also, I tried it again today and the same thing happened. Even when I made a very simple ship (just the cockpit and a booster), the game froze in the spaceplane hangar when I tried to launch. Here is the log, I hope it worked: I basically made the problem happen, closed KSP and then copied the output log file (there is no actual crash when this happens, I have to manually turn the game off).

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/657vl1zrvfqgb40/output_log.txt?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/657vl1zrvfqgb40/output_log.txt?dl=0)

Thanks for the help. It's still happening and I can't use my spaceplane hangar now ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif).

Hi, I did a clean install of KSP recently and I encountered the same issue. I was able to fix it by creating the folder SPH in path\_to\_KSP\saves\name\_of\_your\_savegame\Ships\

It was just missing. It seems it is the same error in your case because of the following line in your log: 

IsolatedStorageException: Could not find a part of the path "C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\saves\Darth Kerman\Ships\SPH\Auto-Saved Ship.craft".

I expect chrism78's fix is what you need as you have this in the log.

    DirectoryNotFoundException: Directory 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\saves\Darth Kerman\Ships\SPH' not found.
Yes, I think that fixed it. Thank you very much for the help ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).
